AS USEFUL AS BEING HIT IN THE FACE WITH.Defintion: used to indicate that something isn't useful at all

AVOIDING.Defintion: staying away from someone or something

BITE-SIZED.Defintion: able to be consumed in small chunks

CHORE.Defintion: a job or piece of work that is often boring or unpleasant but needs to be done regularly

COMES ACROSS.Defintion: to behave in a way that makes people believe that you have a particular characteristic

CORE.Defintion: the basic and most important part of something

DEVIATION.Defintion: to do something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

DISHEARTENED.Defintion: having lost confidence, hope, and energy

ELUSIVE.Defintion: difficult to describe, find, achieve, or remember

ENDLESSLY.Defintion: in a way that is endless (= never finishing, or seeming never to finish)

ENGAGE.Defintion: to become involved, or have contact, with someone or something

FRAMING.Defintion: to express something choosing your words carefully

HACK.Defintion: shortcuts that avoid you doing what others do

HACKS.Defintion: shortcuts that avoid you doing what others do

HESITATE.Defintion: to pause before you do or say something, often because you are uncertain or nervous about it

LINGUISTIC.Defintion: connected with language or the study of language

LITERATE.Defintion: having a good education or showing it in your writing‚Äç

MINIMISE.Defintion: to reduce something to the least possible level or amount

MIRACULOUSLY.Defintion: in a way that is very surprising or difficult to believe

MOMENTUM.Defintion: the force that keeps an object moving or keeps an event developing after it has started

MOTIVATE.Defintion: to make someone want to do something well

MOUSTACHE.Defintion: hair that a man grows above his upper lip

NOD.Defintion: to move your head down and then up, sometimes several times, especially to show agreement, approval, or greeting, or to show something by doing this

NUANCED.Defintion: characterised by subtle shades of meaning or expression

ORATOR.Defintion: someone who is good at public speaking

ORATORS.Defintion: someone who is good at public speaking

OVER AND ABOVE.Defintion: above or higher than something else, sometimes so that one thing covers the other

PACE.Defintion: the speed at which someone or something moves, or with which something happens or changes

PAT ON THE BACK.Defintion: praise, e.g. he gave himself a pat on the back for his achievements

PATRONISE.Defintion: to speak to or behave towards someone as if they are stupid or not important

PRESTIGIOUS.Defintion: respect and admiration given to someone or something, usually because of a reputation for high quality, success, or social influence

PROXY.Defintion: a situation, process, or activity to which another situation, etc. is compared, especially in order to calculate how successful or unsuccessful it is

SCHOLARSHIP.Defintion: an amount of money given by a school, college, university, or other organization to pay for the studies of a person

SMALL-TALK.Defintion: conversation about things that are not important, often between people who do not know each other well

SQUEEZE.Defintion: to force someone or something into a small space or a short period of time

TACTICS.Defintion: a planned way of doing something

TEDIOUS.Defintion: boring Relish: to like or enjoy something

ZERO-SUM.Defintion: used to refer to a situation in which any win by one person always means a loss to another person involved
